On 12/16/2005 11:20 AM, jason r tibbetts apparently said:

> I've been on an XDoclet kick lately, and I'm considering writing a
> custom XDoclet task that will automatically generate an AllTests class
> for each package. Has anyone already done this, or is there a similar,
> non-XDoclet solution? It can be easily done by any scripting language,
> but I have an ulterior motive to using XDoclet--I'm looking for a simple
> example to use in tutorials and presentations.

JUnit-Addons has the DirectoryBuilder which we use on our projects.  It 
doesn't produce an AllTests class but it produces a suite on the fly.

-- 
Jason Rogers
